Class StudentController

java.lang.Object
controllers.StudentController
public class StudentController extends Object
This class is the controller for the Student class.

      public static StudentController getInstance(HashMap<String,User> studentsList)

      Parameters:
      studentsList - The list of students in the system.
      Returns:
      The instance of the StudentController class.

      This method is used to get the instance of the StudentController class. It is a singleton class.
      Returns:
      The instance of the StudentController class.

    • getStudentbyID

      public Student getStudentbyID(String id)
      This method is used to get the student with the given ID.
      Parameters:
      id - The ID of the student to be retrieved.
      Returns:

    • requestAlloc

      public boolean requestAlloc(Student user, int id)
      This method is used to request allocation of a project.
      Parameters:
      user - The student requesting the allocation.
      id - The ID of the project to be allocated.
      Returns:
      True if the request was successful, false otherwise.

    • requestNewTitle

      public boolean requestNewTitle(Student user, String title)
      This method is used to request a new title for the registered project.
      Parameters:
      user - The student requesting the new title.
      title - New title to be implemented.
      Returns:
      True if the request was successful, false otherwise.

    • viewRegisteredProject

      public boolean viewRegisteredProject(Student user)
      This method is used to view the registered project.
      Parameters:
      user - The student whose registered project is to be viewed.
      Returns:
      True if there is a registered project, false otherwise.

    • DeregisterProject

      public boolean DeregisterProject(Student user)
      This method is to deregister the student from the project.
      Parameters:
      user - The student who is deregistering.
      Returns:
      True if the student was deregistered, false otherwise.
